title: Compositing and Blending Level 1
description: Compositing describes how shapes of different elements are combined into a single image by overlaying, masking, blending, etc. The specification also defines a syntax for using compositing in CSS.

title: CSS Masking Module Level 1
description: CSS Masking provides two means for partially or fully hiding portions of visual elements: masking and clipping. Masking describes how to use another graphical element or image as a luminance or alpha mask. Clipping describes the visible region of visual elements. This module defines faetures for both SVG and CSS.

title: CSS Transforms Module Level 1
description: CSS transforms allows elements styled with CSS to be transformed in two-dimensional or three-dimensional space.

title: CSS Fill and Stroke Module Level 3
description: This module contains the features of CSS relating to filling and stroking text and SVG shapes.

versions.title: CSS Fill and Stroke Module Level 3

title: Filter Effects Module Level 1
description:
Filter effects are a way of processing an element's rendering before it is displayed in the document. Typically, rendering an element via CSS or SVG can conceptually described as if the element, including its children, are drawn into a buffer (such as a raster image) and then that buffer is composited into the elements parent. Filters apply an effect before the compositing stage. Examples of such effects are blurring, changing color intensity and warping the image.

Although originally designed for use in SVG, filter effects are a set a set of operations to apply on an image buffer and therefore can be applied to nearly any presentational environment, including CSS. They are triggered by a style instruction (the ‘filter’ property). This specification describes filters in a manner that allows them to be used in content styled by CSS, such as HTML and SVG. It also defines a CSS property value function that produces a CSS value.

title: Geometry Interfaces Module Level 1
description: This specification provides basic geometric interfaces.

title: Graphics Accessibility API Mappings
description: Defines how user agents map the WAI-ARIA Graphics Module markup to platform accessibility APIs.

title: WAI-ARIA Graphics Module
description: Defines a WAI-ARIA module of core roles, states and properties specific to web graphics. These semantics allow an author to express the logical structure of the graphic to assistive technologies, allowing assistive technologies to provide semantic navigation and adapt styling and interactive features.

title: DOMMatrix interface
description: This specification defines a DOM interface representing 2D and 3D matrices. It is intended to be used as a common interface by SVG, Canvas and CSS Transforms.

title: Motion Path Module Level 1
description: The Motion Path module of CSS defines an additional way to define the position and rotation of elements when rendering a document. The position is given by a trajectory and an offset along that trajectory between 0 and 100%. In combination with animations, the offset can also be animated.

title: SVG Accessibility API Mappings
description: Describes how user agents map SVG markup to platform accessibility APIs. When user agents support this specification, SVG authors can create accessible rich internet applications, including charts, graphs, and other drawings.

title: SVG Integration
description: SVG Integration defines how SVG documents must be processed when used in various contexts, such as CSS background images, HTML ‘iframe’ elements, and so on. These requirements include which features are restricted or disabled, such as scripting and animation.

title: SVG Markers
description: This specification defines SVG markers, a feature for placing re-usable graphical elements along the outline of an SVG shape.

title: SVG Paths
description: This specification defines a syntax and DOM representation for paths, which are shapes that can be rendered in a document. Paths are primarily used for rendering shapes using the SVG 'path' element, but are also used by a number of other Web platform features, such as clipping paths and rendering in an HTML 'canvas'.

title: SVG Strokes
description: This specification defines properties for controlling the appearance of strokes painted for SVG shapes.

title: SVG Transforms 1.0, Part 2: Language
description: This specification extends SVG to allow two-dimensional objects to be displayed using three-dimensional transformations, to allow animated effects such as flipping, zooming and perspective.

title: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) 2
description: This specification defines the features and syntax for Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) Version 2, a language for describing two-dimensional vector and mixed vector/raster graphics. Although an XML serialization is given, processing is defined in terms of a DOM.

title: SVG 1.1/1.2/2.0 Requirements
description: The requirements for SVG versions after SVG 1.0.

title: SVG Color 1.2, Part 2: Language
description: This specification extends SVG for color-managed environments such as print, photography and graphics arts.

title: SVG Color 1.2, Part 1: Primer
description: This primer explains SVG for color-managed environments.

title: SVG Filters 1.2, Part 2: Language
description: This specification allows a wide variety of raster filter effects to be applied to content such as SVG and HTML/CSS, by combining a set of filter primitives.

title: SVG Filters 1.2, Part 1: Primer
description: This primer explains how a wide variety of raster filter effects can be applied to content such as SVG and HTML/CSS.

title: SVG Filter Requirements
description: The requirements for the SVG Filters specification.

title: SVG Parameters 1.0, Part 2: Language
description: This specification extends SVG with a declarative way to incorporate parameter values into reusable SVG content.

versions.title: SVG Referenced Parameter Variables 1.0, Part 2: Language

title: SVG Parameters 1.0, Part 1: Primer
description: This primer explains a declarative way to incorporate parameter values into reusable SVG content.

versions.title: SVG Referenced Parameter Variables 1.0, Part 1: Primer

title: Web Animations
description: This specification defines a model for synchronization and timing of changes to the presentation of a Web page. This specification also defines an application programming interface for interacting with this model and it is expected that further specifications will define declarative means for exposing these features.
